Posts.Content: Hi Kate you are right.  The not so nice version is so apt. That's exactly what I feel the treatment has been. " slash. poison.burn and more poison" More realistic.
Posts.Title: What do we call surgery?

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, My chemo nurse told me that I could delay chemo if I knew I had something special that I needed to do. I wonder if you could too? This sounds pretty special. What a morale boost before your next chemo? Keep well xx
Posts.Title: Help! I need to be well 2 days post chemo!

Posts.Content: Hi Cazza40. I am so sorry. I really am. I think that his reasoning is despicable! It is the most disgusting excuse I have heard but unfortunately I have heard this before. I suppose you have 2 choices. Dump him or try to "work it out" with relate. So he's been unfaithful twice then? In October and February? A couple of questions that might help you. Could you forgive him for being unfaithful to you while you were going through treatment for breast cancer?  Could you see a future with a husband who you can not trust and has let you down in your darkest hour? Could you live with the stress and worry that he will be unfaithful to you again?   Does he love you?  I believe that unfaithfulness is not a weakness because a man is "stressed". I believe that they choose to do it and it is NOT YOUR FAULT. I am no expert so perhaps the best thing would be to speak to one. You need to look after yourself.  I am so sorry.
Posts.Title: Unfaithful husband

Posts.Content: Hi Flower. I've spent a fortune on different bras and have settled for a high impact sports bra to keep myself even lol.  I've had a mastectomy and reconstruction which is smaller and and more pert then my other breast. My surgeon has offered to lift and reduce my normal breast so I am even. I would tell your surgeon that you are not happy and ask if there is anything he can do for you to help you. Good luck. Keep going you are nearly there. Lots of hugs to you.
Posts.Title: Bra Trouble After WLE

Posts.Content: My first ever breast screening mammogram at 51 has saved my life. I had no lump, no clinical symptoms at all. After further investigations they revealed that I had IDC in 3 different areas of the breast. Fortunately it had not spread into the lymph nodes. I am very grateful for that mammogram!
Posts.Title: breast screening - real facts

Posts.Content: Well done! you are over the worst. What a lovely hubby to help you with your cravings. Pineapples are good for that horrible tongue. I've "done" 4 Docetaxel cycles and they have been all the same. I think once you have got over the 1st cycle you know what to expect. You just have to "give in" to the wiped out days, knowing its going to get better. Your days will get better now until the next cycle.
Posts.Title: First Docetaxel

Posts.Content: Good morning everyone! I was wondering if anyone else was experiencing problems with their relationships during this time. My boyfriend ( we don't live together and I mainly visited him because I have 2 teenage girls, say no more! ) was very supportive to begin with but now I think it's all become to much for him as he is finding more overtime to do etc all the classic signs of withdrawing. My daughters are also "acting up" a lot more now. ( Their father died of a heart attack 7 years ago). They were very rude when he last visited. They can be quite hurtful. Which is very shocking. The cancer, mastectomy and chemo are not getting me down its my homelife!
Posts.Title: Relationship problems

Posts.Content: Thank you so much every one for your replies, advice and pep talk. I do actually feel better. It really does help to see others perspective in relationships with cancer. So it seems that a little withdrawal from my boyfriend is normal only time will tell. People say that I'm positive, strong  and I'm doing really well. I think its because its happening to me. I lost a boob, haven't really missed it. I had a reconstruction same time. My hair is falling out. It'll grow back. I know how the yucky chemo days feel. I know I'll get through it. BUT it must be very,very scary to watch all of this happening to a loved one. I am so sorry I feel for you. It's worse I'm sure. I suppose the best advice I could give Sarah, would be to just be there for him. Don't let him feel lonely. Go to the appointments together. Make that special snack on yucky chemo days. Lots of love and hugs. My daughters are acting up because they are teenagers and I'm not myself.  School have been very good and have a social worker who is spending time with them. They have been good today.  I feel very positive thank you all. Lots of love and hugs from me xx
Posts.Title: Relationship problems

Posts.Content: Hi Squirrel I've "done" the tax x4. I can say for me it's not so bad and its do-able.  I still have my nails and I didn't paint them. My hands and feet are fine. I didn't get admitted to hospital. So I think I'm one of the lucky ones. Even my hair is growing back after 2nd cycle! I did take my meds as instructed and was careful with mouth care etc. I bought in foods I new I would like when my taste buds were affected for about 6 days.  I did find that I had to have a "duvet day" day 4 and 5 of the cycles.  We are all different and I hope its not so scary for you now. Take care.
Posts.Title: 2 more FEC then 4 tax, i am in pieces worrying

Posts.Content: Hi Jeniren, I live in North Wales and had the surgery done in my local hospital by the consultant breast surgeon. I don't know if I can name names on here so I'll private message you.
Posts.Title: reconstruction surgery advice

Posts.Content: Hi Shelley, I start chemo on Monday and I had my flu jab today. All well so far! It's not a "live" vaccine in that it contains any virus but you can get achey. So no you're not imagining it. You sound like you've been through an awlful lot. My thoughts are with you. Best wishes and hugs xx
Posts.Title: Flu jab question

Posts.Content: Hi Jane, I had a mastectomy with immediate reconstruction last September. My surgeon used a silicone implant which was placed under the chest muscle.It feels and looks very natural, with actual feelings to the touch, in the top half of the breast. I can lie on my tummy and the tissue around it looks natural.  My cleavage in a bra is excellent. Looks normal. ( 38DD ) I am very pleased with it. Even so my surgeon has offered me a lift and slight reduction to the unaffected breast to even them up a bit. ( I didn't realize how far south they had gone lol). I have been offered a nipple and tattoo as well! I have full movement and swim. I am back in work but not allowed to lift anything heavy. I hope that my experience is of help to you. As each N.H.S trust is different it may be good for you to discuss your options with your breast care nurse.  Good luck and take care.
Posts.Title: reconstruction surgery advice

Posts.Content: Sashca I have been reading your  suicidal thoughts on here daily now and I have to say something. Get your self back to the UK. Get a 2nd 3rd even 4th and 5th  opinion if you have to! I'm sure something can be done. Its YOUR life YOU have to take control to get something done. I live in Wales and was given choices of which reconstruction, which hospital ( Wales or England) and when ( any time span I liked. Months, years ).  Another thing that upsets me the word "amputee". I have two sons in the army they have friends coming back from Afgan............. You are not an amputee after a mastectomy. Every single person that has posted on here is feeling for you and wanting to give their love and support with practical advice.
Posts.Title: Two years....!

Posts.Content: Hi  Tinned pineapple and juice worked for me while I was having chemo. You may need to see your G.P just in case it's oral thrush. He/she can prescribe something for it. I changed my toothbrush after every cycle and when I completed chemo. Well done for finishing your treatment.
Posts.Title: Mouth problems

Posts.Content: Hi Amy, My first chemo is on Mon. So you are not alone! My hair is down to my waist. My pride and joy. I know it would really upset me to see it fall out all over the place! My partner wants to keep my ponytail but cant bring himself to cut or shave it. I'm not sure when the best time is either? I see the wig lady Tues and already have a scarf and a sleep hat. I hope you dont mind me jumping on your thread to watch for any advice given to you? Good luck xx
Posts.Title: hair :-(

Posts.Content: What a lovely idea Lilybeth. Thankyou. I am going to cut it off whole and keep it for later. Thats an  encouraging thought to hold onto.  Londongurl.  Thankyou for your advice too. I too have been caught very early but have scored 2% over on the test thingy for chemo. So at least I know why I am going to loose my hair. Keep "butting in" please your advice is invaluble. Jellytot. How lovely! I'm crying too. How selfish am I ? I've not even thought about little girls who loose their hair........ puts alot into perspective doesnt it?
Posts.Title: hair :-(

Posts.Content: We are all different and we have to find out what works for us. I found fresh kiwi fruit worked for me too. Lots of vit C as well. All good. I had Tax so no taste buds as well as a sore mouth!  Like I said tinned pineapple worked for me. I could taste it and it helped my sore mouth. Easy to prepare and cheap when you feel grotty.   ( I didn't have a OH to prepare any food for me. had to look after myself. Nobody to shop for me either ).   Mac nurses specialize  in cancer patients, their treatment and care. They are brilliant!  Ward nurses specialize in their patients, their treatment and care.  They are brilliant!  A&E nurses specialize in their patients, their treatment and care. They are brilliant!
Posts.Title: Mouth problems

Posts.Content: Thank you for your reply and thoughts Yvonne, That sounds like a good plan! I'll be asking the wig lady on Tuesday. Wow and if you are at at the hairdressers already there is light at the end of the tunnel!
Posts.Title: hair :-(

Posts.Content: Hi Claire  sorry to find you here at this hour! but you are in the right place. the lovely ladies will be along in the morning with lots of advice to help you. I was in a similar position to you four months ago. Node was clear and er+ . I made the choice to have Chemo because the oncologist had said there was a very slight chance that cancer cells could escape into the blood stream and spread that way.  So in my mind I needed to prevent that and throw everything at it they were offering. I'm a single parent of two teenagers ( their father died 8 years ago). So I still need to be around for them and plus I  want to enjoy retirement!  I suppose I made the choice because I wanted peace of mind that I have done everything to get rid of this cancer. Chemo is very tough but do-able. The choice that you will make will be very personal to you. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Chemo - Should I have it or not?

Posts.Content: Thank you Ladies  You have just answered some of my questions. I have a prescription for Tamoxifen to start taking next weekend. Nicky can I ask you which chemist stocks the Wockhart brand? My oncologist advised Evening Primrose will give that a go as well. Thank you for all your advice. A big sorry for jumping on your thread Rachael. I'm a bit worried too. Good luck xx
Posts.Title: has anyone had any possive experiences with Tamoxifen????? Am due...

Posts.Content: Hi Kiera I'm not very clever with words but I want you to know that  I know how you are feeling, I know what you are going through. All I can do is send you lots of hugs, best wishes and to say that I am thinking of you. You will find the inner strength do deal with this. xx
Posts.Title: I can't cope anymore

Posts.Content: Hi Beachbabe. Its almost a year now since I started chemo and was where you are now. When my head became sore and painful and I found hair on my pillow I bought a ladyshaver and shaved my head in the shower. I was so relieved! Don't worry about your husband. He should understand. So my girls did not have too much of a shock I wore little caps at first. You can get then from Hannah Bandanna online.  After a while my youngest daughter pulled it off and wasn't very shocked at all. Now 8 months later I have a pixie cut and I get a lot of complements in work. Just think in 8 months time you will be where I am now! Take care of yourself.
Posts.Title: EC and hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi Dreamthief, Jackie is an inspiration and George you are a wonderful support to her!  I too will be going back to work in A&E in a few weeks time, after a whirlwind of only 6 months! Lumpectomy, mastectomy/reconstruction, Tax x4 and now tamoxifen.  I still have no hair! I couldn't "get on" with the wig and don't want to wear chemo scarves. So have come up with the plan to wear a scrub hat. Shouldn't look too out of place.  May I ask Jackie how long your hair is now?  Thank you for your inspirational message this morning.
Posts.Title: Turning Corners and a Bit of Inspiration :-)

Posts.Content: Hi George & Jackie, A little while to wait for hair then? I had my last chemo 10th December. How on earth did your daughter concentrate? I hope that she can relax a little now. Yes that's the same link for the youtube video. Hope they don't slap you!
Posts.Title: Turning Corners and a Bit of Inspiration :-)

Posts.Content: Hi Cloe I am so sorry that you are very conflicted and very confused. Gosh we've all been there dozens of times! Everyone here is really trying to help you. But I have found some of your remarks very upsetting and undermining so I need to comment. I am one of those woman who at this moment in time who has chosen the very tried and tested, conventional route and is trying to "come to terms" with the side effects plus the loss of a breast and my hair. WHY go down this path? Because I want to live. I want the best chance I can get for myself and my family. I'll fight for that and go through the hardship of leaving my "immune system to deal with the after effects , if it can". I turn to this site as I know I am not alone.There are some lovely ladies here who have given me some very helpful advice as I travel down this route. They all mean well and have every ones best interests at heart.  When I sat with my breast care team and oncologist to discuss my treatment not once did I feel that they were giving me the cheaper, cost effective version. Thank goodness for the N.H.S. If I had to pay for all of my treatments I would be dead!
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi katymargaret  Your works nurse is employed by your work to make you work! Shame on her expecting you to work through rads. She's just "googling" her info. She's no expert.  Go back to work when you feel you can. My G.P signed me off for as long as I wanted. (6 months in my case). I know some woman have taken a year out. Be kind to yourself.
Posts.Title: Time off work

Posts.Content: Hi Carriek, I've had a mastectomy and reconstruction with an inplant.  I'm starting chemo tomorrow so advised to have an uplift and reduction on the other breast at a later date. It should be a better match when the inplant has settled down.  I was able to get a lot of advice from my surgeon and breast care nurse ( She should be able to tell you what your surgeon is qualified to do ) . But in the end the decision is only ours.  For myself the one wound, pain and "clipped wing" on one side was enough to deal with at the time. I was happier with a quicker recovery time for my own peace of mind! I hope my experience and that of lots of others here can be of help for you to make your decision?
Posts.Title: Anyone had Mx, reconstruction (LD - Back flap) and reduction in other...

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies has anyone had any experience with dating after breast cancer? After discussion with some male friends/colleagues,  I have concluded that  a man would like to know from the start if a women has had a mastectomy etc etc.  Female colleagues say don't put anything like that on my profile. It will scare them off! To be honest if they are going to be scared off. I would sooner it be before I met them!  When and how do you tell a man that you have had a mastectomy? I'm on tamoxifen and I think a sex life is going to be difficult.  Any suggestion?
Posts.Title: Dating again after breast cancer?

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy. I had a mastectomy / immediate reconstruction with a silicon implant. 31st Aug last year and I haven't looked back! ( Only I had my 4 Tax after ). When I woke up from surgery, I still had a cleavage. that was important to me and my surgeon knew it. I'm very pleased with his work. ( I'm a 38DD ). The 1st week was a bit rough. I needed to be propped up in bed to sleep. ( couldn't sleep on my side). I also needed regular painkillers and had the drain in for a week.  By the 2nd week I was driving and went to a fancy dress beach party! ( I did sit a lot and drank orange juice to be on the safe side).  Like you say we are all different. I hope very much that everything goes smoothly for you to get to your daughters wedding. What a lovely event to look forward to after treatment! Take care.
Posts.Title: Recovery after Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi Earl, Here is some hope for you lol. I am 4 weeks post tax x4 and still have all my nails, fingers and toes.  I didn't paint them just used hand and foot cream though out the day. Perhaps I was one of the lucky ones. Hope you are too!  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Black nail varnish & Docetaxel
